author: La Gaceta
title: Diputados: fracas√≥ la iniciativa del kirchnerismo de avanzar contra el DNU que le asigna $100.000 millones a la SIDE
text: El oficialismo logr√≥ dilatar el tratamiento de los decretos de necesidad y urgencia (DNU) sobre la Secretar√≠a de Inteligencia del Estado ( SIDE ) en la Comisi√≥n Bicameral de Tr√°mite Legislativo. La oposici√≥n, liderada por Uni√≥n por la Patria y Nicol√°s Massot, unific√≥ un dictamen de rechazo al DNU 656/2024, que reestructur√≥ a la SIDE y le asign√≥ gastos reservados por $ 100.000 millones. Sin embargo, el pedido para tratar este DNU en la reuni√≥n fue rechazado. Pese al rechazo unificado de la oposici√≥n, los diputados radicales Francisco Monti y el senador V√≠ctor Zimmermann no acompa√±aron el dictamen. El presidente de la Bicameral, Juan Carlos Pagotto, argument√≥ que no se incluyeron los DNU porque la Ley 25.520 los asigna a la Comisi√≥n Bicameral de Inteligencia, que a√∫n no se conform√≥. La oposici√≥n critic√≥ a Pagotto por incumplir el acuerdo de reuniones semanales. La moci√≥n de la oposici√≥n para tratar los DNU en la reuni√≥n fue rechazada por los votos del oficialismo y algunos partidos opositores. En cambio, se aprob√≥ fijar las pr√≥ximas reuniones de la Bicameral para los d√≠as 22 de agosto, 5 y 19 de septiembre. Mientras tanto, la cuesti√≥n central es que el 14 de agosto vencen los plazos de la Ley 26.122 sobre regulaci√≥n legislativa de los DNU, por lo que a partir del 15 podr√°n ser tratados en el recinto. Si bien el oficialismo dilat√≥ el debate, en una semana el DNU 656/2024 podr√° ser puesto a consideraci√≥n en el Senado y Diputados. All√≠, la oposici√≥n ya present√≥ proyectos de rechazo, como el antecedente del DNU 70/2023 sobre desregulaci√≥n econ√≥mica y la propuesta de la Coalici√≥n C√≠vica de declararlo "nulo de nulidad absoluta".

title: Supresa: Iraque derrota Jap√£o e est√° nos ‚Äòoitavos‚Äô da Ta√ßa Asi√°tica | Abola.pt

author: VNExplorer
title: El presidente Joe Biden se confunde ante las elecciones de Venezuela
text: Joe Biden confunde elecciones en Venezuela El presidente malinterpret√≥ la situaci√≥n ¬øQu√© caus√≥ tanta pol√©mica? El presidente de Estados Unidos, Joe Biden, malinterpret√≥ este jueves una pregunta sobre la celebraci√≥n de nuevas elecciones en Venezuela. Lo que cre√≥ horas de confusi√≥n despu√©s de que diera a entender que apoyaba la repetici√≥n de los comicios. La confusi√≥n se produjo cuando Biden compareci√≥ brevemente ante la prensa antes de subir al helic√≥ptero presidencial Marine One. Cuando una periodista le pregunt√≥ si apoyaba la convocatoria de nuevos comicios en Venezuela, se limit√≥ a contestar: ¬´S√≠, lo hago¬ª, sin ofrecer m√°s detalles. JOE BIDEN SE CONFUNDE POR LAS ELECCIONES EN VENEZUELA Foto: Shutterstock Sin embargo, horas despu√©s, un portavoz de la Casa Blanca aclar√≥ que el presidente en realidad se estaba refiriendo a lo ¬´absurdo¬ª de que el mandatario de Venezuela, Nicol√°s Maduro, no haya publicado las actas de votaci√≥n de los comicios del 28 de julio. Donde el oficialismo proclam√≥ la reelecci√≥n de Maduro con unos resultados cuestionados dentro y fuera del pa√≠s. Te puede interesar:Ernesto se convierte en hurac√°n al norte de Puerto Rico y cientos huyen a refugios Ese portavoz reiter√≥ que Washington considera que el ganador de los comicios fue el opositor Edmundo Gonz√°lez Urrutia, seg√∫n las actas obtenidas por el bloque opositor mayoritario. Y de nuevo llam√≥ a que se respete ¬´la voluntad¬ª del pueblo venezolano para que haya una ¬´transici√≥n de vuelta a las normas democr√°ticas¬ª. ¬øC√≥mo surge esta nueva pol√©mica? El debate sobre la celebraci√≥n de nuevos comicios en Venezuela se da durante este jueves, durante una entrevista en la Radio T. Donde el presidente brasile√±o, Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva, sugiriese dos posibles salidas a la crisis postelectoral en Venezuela: La formaci√≥n de un Gobierno de coalici√≥n que integre miembros del chavismo y de la oposici√≥n o la celebraci√≥n de nuevas elecciones. Las declaraciones de Lula provocaron enseguida la reacci√≥n del presidente de M√©xico, Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador, quien dijo que no ve ¬´prudente¬ª pedir ahora nuevas elecciones en Venezuela. ¬øSi habr√° elecciones? Mientras tanto, el presidente de Colombia, Gustavo Petro, sugiri√≥ para Venezuela un ¬´frente nacional¬ª como el que hubo en Colombia en el siglo XX. En el que liberales y conservadores se turnaban el poder como paso ¬´transitorio¬ª hacia una ¬´soluci√≥n definitiva¬ª a la crisis. En una idea similar a la sugerida por Lula sobre un Gobierno de coalici√≥n. Despu√©s de las elecciones en Venezuela, los Gobiernos de Brasil, Colombia y M√©xico iniciaron contactos para encontrar una soluci√≥n a la crisis, un esfuerzo de mediaci√≥n que cuenta entre otros con el respaldo de Estados Unidos. CON INFORMACI√ìN DE EFE. Para escuchar el podcast de esta y otras noticias da click en la foto FOTO MundoNOW

author: Olivia J McClure
title: Despite floods and delays, officials gather to officially cut ribbon on Zachary park | Zachary | theadvocate.com
text: The BREC park on Church Street in Zachary holds a special place in the hearts of many residents. Take Mayor David McDavid and Police Chief Darryl Lawrence, for example. Both played basketball in the park‚Äôs gym in their younger days. McDavid grew up participating in other activities at the park, including a program taught by his mother, who is still involved with BREC today at 82 years old. As elected officials, McDavid and Lawrence value the park as a space providing much-needed recreational and educational opportunities for Zachary residents. ‚ÄúThis facility means a lot,‚Äù McDavid said. But the 7-acre complex, which BREC purchased from the Zachary Lions Club in 1977, has endured challenge upon challenge in recent years. BREC was in the early stages of a $1.5 million project to update the park when heavy rains struck the area in August 2016, filling the recreational center with 2 feet of water that damaged the basketball court, floors, walls and electrical system. BREC spent the next couple of years working with FEMA and got the facility back up and running in 2020. It briefly reopened ‚Äî only to be shut down at the onset of the coronavirus pandemic. Then, later that year, a rainstorm flooded the building again, and BREC had to replace flooring and remediate mold. With all repairs and upgrades finally complete, BREC and local elected officials celebrated the revamped Church Street Park at a ceremony Dec. 27. The park actually has been open for about a year, but scheduling difficulties delayed the ribbon-cutting event. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs wonderful to see the rebirth, the rebirth and the rebirth of it,‚Äù said state Rep. Barbara West Carpenter, D-Baton Rouge. ‚ÄúYou have a beautiful facility now ‚Äî one that the residents of Zachary can be proud of.‚Äù In addition to the updated gym with its new basketball court, amenities include meeting and activity rooms, storage space, a pavilion, a playground, an outdoor basketball court and a lighted, multipurpose field. Perhaps most significantly, several people at the ceremony said, the gym now has air conditioning ‚Äî something that many BREC recreation centers do not have. Lawrence recalled playing basketball in sweltering conditions during visits to the facility when he was younger. ‚ÄúThis air conditioning will be a big help,‚Äù he said. Leaders noted the important role that BREC parks play in the community. ‚ÄúA successful parks system and recreation amenities are the cornerstone to a successful community,‚Äù said Ambre DeVirgilio, a member of the Zachary City Council whose district includes the Church Street Park. ‚ÄúSo many kids in this community have benefitted from BREC. ‚Ä¶ It means a lot to see this facility come back,‚Äù McDavid added. The Church Street Park project is just one of several that BREC is wrapping up in the northern part of East Baton Rouge Parish, said Reed Richard, assistant superintendent of BREC. The agency is continuing highly anticipated renovations at the Greenwood Community Park and Baton Rouge Zoo near Baker. It also is catching up on repairs and making upgrades to other parks that sustained flood damage in 2016, including Baton Rouge‚Äôs Howell Community Park and, in Central, the Lovett Road Park and Frenchtown Road Conservation Area. Richard is looking forward to welcoming residents to new and updated facilities in 2024. ‚ÄúThis is going to be a year of ribbon-cuttings,‚Äù he said.

author: Tania Carballo
title: Borrar tu huella con cada pisada: las baldosas que transforman tus pasos en energ√≠a renovable
text:
Si toda la energ√≠a que producimos al d√≠a se aprovechase, no tendr√≠amos que preocuparnos de la factura de la luz al final del mes. Y si nuestros pasos se convirtieran en electricidad, solo con nuestros pies se podr√≠a iluminar al mundo entero. Ya hay quienes se est√°n atreviendo a esto mismo, de la mano de tecnolog√≠as que prometen dar un golpe sobre la mesa (y sobre el suelo).
[ Las plantas hablan: un grupo de expertos explica la curiosa raz√≥n por la que pueden comunicarse ]
Nuestra vida est√° llena de rutinas que pueden suponer un perjuicio para la conservaci√≥n del medio ambiente. Para participar en el cambio, lo principal es ser conscientes de todo aquello que podemos cambiar.
Han pasado 14 a√±os desde que Laurence Kemball-Cook, en ese entonces estudiante de dise√±o industrial de la Universidad de Loughborough (Reino Unido), pens√≥ en qu√© pod√≠a hacer √©l para participar en ese cambio.
Lo √∫nico que le hizo falta fue darse cuenta de que la estaci√≥n de tren de Victoria que utilizaba regularmente recib√≠a alrededor de 75 millones de visitantes cada a√±o. Entonces, Laurence pens√≥ en lo que pasar√≠a si aprovechase cada paso que las personas dan en su d√≠a a d√≠a.
De esa reflexi√≥n nacieron las baldosas Pavegen , un innovador m√©todo que aprovecha cada pisada para transformarla en energ√≠a sustentable, que cambia de base la generaci√≥n de electricidad mediante fuentes renovables. Con este ingenio, el creador no solo quiere cambiar el mundo, sino demostrar el poder transformador de la tecnolog√≠a para generar cambios positivos.
Baldosas Pavegen.
Iluminar las calles a nuestro paso Las ciudades est√°n repletas de personas. Si pensamos en una capital como Madrid, tan solo unas cuantas baldosas Pavegen podr√≠an suponer una transformaci√≥n en la calidad de vida. La tecnolog√≠a por s√≠ sola no har√° un mundo m√°s sostenible , eso est√° en nuestra mano y en cambiar nuestro comportamiento de cara a aquello que queremos para nuestro futuro.
De ah√≠ naci√≥ la idea de los pasos ecol√≥gicos, buscando una baldosa de 45 x 60 cent√≠metros que se hunde cinco mil√≠metros y genera ocho vatios de energ√≠a con cada pisada.
Baldosa Pavegen.
Las baldosas verdes est√°n pensadas para espacios p√∫blicos con mucha afluencia de personas: estaciones de tren, aeropuertos, centros comerciales o colegios donde millones de pisadas transcurren d√≠a a d√≠a.
El peso de las personas hace que la baldosa comprima un generador electromagn√©tico y ocasione un movimiento giratorio para producir de 2 a 4 julios de energ√≠a limpia fuera de la red.
La energ√≠a generada por millones de pisadas es utilizada para impulsar herramientas de sostenibilidad como iluminaci√≥n LED, mobiliario urbano inteligente, aplicaciones, iluminaci√≥n de se√±ales o zonas wifi.
A pesar de que pensemos que las personas perciben el hundimiento de la baldosa, lo cierto es que el movimiento es m√≠nimo, por lo que quien camina sobre ella no se da cuenta de que est√° generando energ√≠a.
Sin embargo, la efectividad de estas baldosas s√≠ depende de quien las pise . El peso de un ni√±o peque√±o no genera el movimiento suficiente como para generar energ√≠a; en cambio, una persona adulta s√≠ contribuir√≠a a este cambio.
No solo las pisadas son las que hacen que las baldosas energ√≠a, sino que se puede saltar sobre ellas, correr o bailar. La propia empresa de Pavegen ha organizado diferentes eventos como pistas de baile, experiencias o carreras para generar energ√≠a.
Evento de baile de Pavegen.
Adem√°s, la tecnolog√≠a de Pavegen crea experiencias muy atractivas , al utilizar la energ√≠a renovable de una pisada, para educar e involucrar a clientes y partes interesadas por igual.
Las empresas tambi√©n est√° aline√°ndose con marcas sostenibles y a su vez est√°n generando cambios positivos e inspirando un pensamiento m√°s consciente en todo nuestro planeta.
Sigue los temas que te interesan Energ√≠a Objetivo 13: Acci√≥n por el clima Objetivo 7: Energ√≠a asequible y no contaminante Objetivo 9: Industria, innovaci√≥n e infraestructura Sostenibilidad

author: Los Angeles Times - Kate Linthicum
title: This professor studies dictatorships. He helped convince Harvard to stand up to Trump | Flipboard
text:
This professor studies dictatorships. He helped convince Harvard to stand up to Trump CAMBRIDGE, Mass. ‚Äî In the days after Donald Trump‚Äôs reelection as president, Harvard political scientist Steven Levitsky was despondent. ‚ÄúI was in the fetal position,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI just wanted to put on sweat pants, eat ice cream and watch hockey.‚Äù Levitsky had spent two decades studying authoritarian ‚Ä¶

author: Olivia Miwil
title: Daughter of plantation worker aspires to be a journalist
text:
BEAUFORT: Nura* broke into tears as she listened to her mother, Mariam*, tell visitors that the family would do their best to change their children's future through education.
Mariam said her 15-year-old eldest child had shown unwavering determination and passion in her dream of becoming a journalist.
"Back in our hometown in Indonesia, Nura learned early that without education, life is difficult.
"Life hasn't been easy since we came to Sabah either. My husband works on a smallholder plantation estate and supports our family of five.
"He doesn't earn much, but we still make sure our children go to school even if it means I have to eat less," she said, adding that the family pays several hundred ringgit a month for the shuttle service to send their three children to a nearby community learning centre (CLC).
She added that unless Nura was severely ill, the girl would insist on attending classes at the centre, which caters to children of plantation workers.
Mariam spoke to journalists who visited her home as part of the six-month Tuai Cerita Fellowship Programme.
As the eldest child, Nura said she feels a great sense of responsibility and hopes that her examination results from the learning centre will earn her a scholarship and placement at a school in Kota Kinabalu run by the Indonesian consulate-general.
Eventually, she hopes it will also lead to a place at a university in Indonesia.
Earlier, the delegation also visited Nura's CLC here which currently provides basic education to about 100 children aged up to 15.
In Sabah, CLCs are alternative learning spaces that provide educational opportunities for children who are not enrolled in formal schools, often due to factors like poverty or lack of access.
These centres aim to ensure that every child, regardless of circumstances, has a chance to learn and develop.
Although the students only attend a few hours of classes daily, their unlimited access to online learning has helped them gain valuable skills suited to today's job market.
Nura, for instance, has become well-versed in graphic design and photography skills she developed through online platforms and which recently won her accolades in local competitions.
"I want to become a journalist who writes for newspapers, not a broadcast journalist or a social media influencer.
"Not just to tell my story, but the stories of others like me, people who are invisible, but full of dreams," she said.
Her friend, Peter*, also 15, said he aspired to become a fireman.
"There was a time when a team of firemen came to fight a fire in my village. They looked so cool.
"I want to be like them, but being a non-citizen here makes it difficult unless I complete my studies here and back in my hometown," he said.
According to the Indonesian consulate-general in Kota Kinabalu, there are 229 community learning centres in Sabah that provide education to children of Indonesian citizens.
Since 2013, it has facilitated the return of 4,036 students to Indonesia to further their studies.
In a separate statement, Unicef Malaysia deputy representative Sanja Saranovic said this year marks 30 years since Malaysia ratified the Convention on the Rights of the Child.
"It is a powerful reminder of the commitment we made to every child. As we reflect on how far we've come.
"It's also a call to action to ensure that no child is left behind ‚Äì especially those in vulnerable settings like in Sabah's oil palm plantation communities.
"When children cannot attend school, whether due to cost, distance, or administrative barriers, they are more likely to be pushed into work. Normalising this practice robs children of their futures."
Tuai Cerita is a fellowship designed to amplify the voices of Sabah's most vulnerable children.
Through the power of storytelling and ethical journalism, we're shining a light on child rights deprivations contributing to child labour in and around oil palm plantations in Sabah.
The programme is driven by local partners, Anak (Advocates for Non-discrimination and Access to Knowledge) and Global Shepherds, and implemented by Project Liber8.
The programme is conducted in partnership with the European Union, International Labour Organisation, and Unicef.
* Not their real names

author: TMZ Staff
title: Taylor Swift Extinguishes Fire In NYC Apartment Kitchen
text: Taylor Swift Fighting Flames In NYC Apartment ... Extinguishes Kitchen Fire The legend of Taylor Swift grows -- she once extinguished a fire in her New York City apartment after flames erupted in her kitchen ... and now, we're seeing it all on video. TayTay's singer friend, Gracie Abrams, just shared footage of Taylor handling a fire extinguisher and putting out a big flame that was burning on the kitchen island in her $50 million Tribeca pad ... this after talking about the incident earlier in the week. Gracie told Billboard she and Taylor stayed up all night writing her new song "Us" when the fire started in another room ... a candle from their dinner party had fallen over and ignited the blaze -- but at first, they didn't realize that's what happened. When they finally figured out there was a fire in the house, Gracie whipped out her phone and filmed a barefoot Taylor grabbing a fire extinguisher ... fiddling with the device before putting out the flames. Waiting for your permission to load the Instagram Media. Taylor and Gracie had left their purses and shoes on the island, right next to the fire ... and everything was ruined by the fire extinguisher fumes, which also gave Gracie and Taylor a major cough. Gracie's freaking out behind the camera the entire time, but Taylor keeps her cool ... and now Gracie's hailing Taylor as a folk hero. She's not entirely wrong ... this is pretty epic.

author: Amaris Encinas
title: What does 12/31/23 mean? The last day of 2023 is an angel number
text: The upcoming year will be filled with blessings, at least that is what the numerical sequence of this New Year‚Äôs Eve date suggests. If you take a closer look at the date, written as 12/31/23 or even 123123, you might see an angel number, which are repeating number sequence s, often used as a guide for deeper spiritual exploration. The numerical sequences can range anywhere from 000 to 999 , with each number having a distinct meaning and energy, USA Today previously reported. The once-in-a-century date, which won‚Äôt be seen again on our calenders until Dec. 31, 2123, marks a new beginning. One, that asks us to ‚Äútransform and evolve with the times and in the right place to embrace what is coming to us,‚Äù according to the Old Farmer‚Äôs Almanac website. The date has also sparked an online trend, with TikTok users creating videos on the significance of the number and merchandise commemorating the date selling online, including on platforms like Amazon , eBay and Etsy , the Detroit Free Press, part of the USA Today Network reported. Here‚Äôs what we know about the date. Numerology is an ancient esoteric science that deals with numbers and letters and the energy, intention and vibration behind them, professional numerologist Novalee Wilder shared with USA Today earlier this month. "Before there was even language, there were numbers," she said. "Before we had named things, we had counted them, and we had assigned meaning to that count." The numbers that make up the angel number are just as important as the whole number, especially when you are trying to determine the vibration and intention behind the number. Professional astrologer Narayana Mont√∫far told Farmer‚Äôs Almanac that the ‚ÄúNumber 1 brings the very spark of initiation, 2 focuses on building, and 3 is related to the concept of creation. Together, the sequence of these three numbers speaks of the spark of initiation that seeks to build a new creation.‚Äù If you add all the numbers that make up the date 123123 together, you will come up with 12. The number 12 in numerology can symbolize spiritual enlightenment, with potential for the day to deliver epiphanies and ‚Äúaha‚Äù moments for individuals and society at large, the website stated. FYI: How to keep your pets calm during New Year's Eve fireworks If you are an angel number enthusiast, there are a few key dates you might want to keep in mind as 2024 rapidly approaches. A palindrome, not unlike an angel number, is a term typically reserved for words or phrases that are spelled the same way backward as they are forward. Words like level, kayak, civic, and radar are among some of the most common palindromes, according to the Old Farmer‚Äôs Almanac. Numerical sequences seen in dates or times can also be palindromes, the most well-recognized ones being 3/20/23 or 11:11 , the website stated. Here are all palindrome dates that will occur in 2024, courtesy of the Farmer‚Äôs Almanac : Contributing: Olivia Munson, USA Today 30 famous Capricorns you should know: These celebrities belong to the winter Zodiac sign
